alert.note: Alert for Essex; Middlesex; Norfolk; Suffolk; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 11:39AM EDT until August 08 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN WORCESTER, NORTHWESTERN NORFOLK, SUFFOLK, SOUTH CENTRAL ESSEX AND SOUTHEASTERN MIDDLESEX COUNTIES... At 1139 AM EDT, trained weather spotters reported significant street flooding in Wellesley and Natick from thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen, with the highest rainfall totals falling from Bellingham to Brookline. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Boston, Cambridge, Quincy, Lynn, Newton, Somerville, Framingham, Waltham, Malden, Brookline, Medford, Revere, Peabody, Arlington, Everett, Salem, Beverly, Woburn, Chelsea and Natick. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
